issue.title: midpoint should not constrain T is complete

discussion.p: The constraint of the midpoint overload in :

blockquote.pre: template<class T> constexpr T* midpoint(T* a, T* b);

blockquote.p: -4- Constraints: T is a complete object type.

discussion.p: is incorrect. Paragraph 4 states T is constrained to be a complete object type, however it does not seem to be possible to implement T is complete. This means behavior is conditioned dependent on whether a type is complete, and this seems inconsistent with the library precedent.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4810.

blockquote.pre: template<class T> constexpr T* midpoint(T* a, T* b);

blockquote.p:
-4- Constraints: T is an complete object type.
-?- Mandates: T is a complete type.
[…]
